name: Abominable
effect: Scan doesn’t reveal any information about the Horror except that they are a Horror.

name: Mutations
effect: The Horror may choose 1 option from the Horror Mutations list plus an additional option per tier.

name: Quadruped
effect: The Horror gains Immunity to Prone and may move up to 4 spaces as a protocol.

name: Superfluous Extremities
effect: The Horror gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple and may perform Improvised Attack as a quick action.

name: Artificial
effect: This trait can only be applied if the Horror is Biological. The Horror is no longer Biological and gains Heat Cap 6.

name: Terrifying
effect: Attacks against the Horror suffer +1 Difficulty if the attacker has line of sight to the target.

name: Abhorrent Redundancies
effect: Whenever the Horror is reduced to 0 HP, they may roll 1d6. On a 5+, they return to 1 HP and gain {3/4/5} Overshield. After this trait triggers once, it only triggers again on a 6+.

name: Assimilation Maw
effect: Additionally, if the Horror destroys another character with this weapon, allied or hostile, or hits a wreck, they regain {10/15/20} HP. Wrecks and allies are automatically hit by this weapon. Wrecks hit by this weapon are automatically destroyed.
on_hit: If the target is at half or less HP after this attack is resolved, they must succeed on a Hull save or be reduced to 0 HP.

name: Phase-Shift Generator
effect: As a protocol, the Horror may become Intangible until the start of their next turn. Alternatively they may clear Intangible. The Horror may not become Intangible if they used this system on their last turn.

name: Construction Tools
effect: The Industrial may pick a weapon from the Industrial Weapons list. They may take a second but must replace one of their base weapons when doing so.

name: Civilian Machine
effect: The Industrial receives +1 Difficulty on saves and checks. Tech attacks gain +1 Accuracy against the Industrial.

name: Bulky Construction
effect: The Industrial gains +1 Armor but Boost becomes a full action instead of a quick action.

name: Rock Drill
effect: Additionally, the Industrial may automatically deal 50 AP kinetic damage to an adjacent piece of terrain as a quick action.

name: Industrial Clamps
effect: The Industrial gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple. This weapon automatically hits Grappled characters.

name: Rivet Cannon
effect: This Attack can make {1/2/3} attacks. If one of these attacks knocks a character back into a piece of terrain that stops their movement, they become Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

name: Buzzsaw
effect: On critical hit: This weapon’s base damage is doubled.

name: Wrecker
effect: Whenever this weapon is used to attack it attacks all characters within Threat.

name: Operatives
effect: When choosing optional systems and traits, the Spec Ops can also choose from the Spec Ops Systems and Traits list. Additionally, the Spec Ops can’t take the Grunt, Elite, or Ultra templates.

name: Active Camo
effect: As a protocol, the Spec Ops may expend a charge to become Invisible until the end of their next turn. For the duration of this effect, the Spec Ops’ next melee or ranged attack becomes a critical hit if it hits.

name: Deadly Precision
effect: The Spec Ops deals +{2/3/3} bonus damage on critical hits.

name: Coordinated Carnage
effect: After all Spec Ops characters have taken their turns in a round, a single Spec Ops character may take an additional turn in the usual turn order.

name: Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite
effect: The Spec Ops may Lock On as a protocol. Whenever an allied Spec Ops character within Range 10 consumes any Lock On, their attack is not affected by cover. This system can only be taken by one Spec Ops per combat.

name: Automated Battlefield Awareness Node
effect:
The Spec Ops gains the Battlefield Awareness reaction, which can be used any number of times per round. This system can only be taken by one Spec Ops per combat.
Battlefield Awareness
Trigger: An allied Spec Ops character within Range 8 and line of sight would roll a save.
Effect: They automatically succeed on the save before rolling any dice.

name: Serrated Machete
effect: On critical hit: The target becomes Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Special Munitions
effect:
This character’s Ranged Attacks gain “On critical hit: The target is knocked Prone.”
Additionally, before making a Ranged Attack that deals Kinetic, Energy, or Explosive Damage, the Spec Ops may swap that damage type for one of the other two.

name: Bulwark Mods
effect: The Spec Ops ignores difficult and dangerous terrain.

name: Jump Packs
effect: The Spec Ops can fly whenever it Boosts. It must end this movement on a solid surface or begin falling.

name: Null-Perception Coating
effect: The Spec Ops gains Immunity to Lock On.
